data.title: Samba documents open as empty/Uncaught Error
data.body:
Hi,

I recently started using Atom on Debian Jessie, and on local everything works perfect. But we are using shared drive at work, and when I access it via smb:// and I try to open any file, Atom opens with window title correctly saying "filename - smb://path/to/ - Atom", in tree view I see filename with folder icon, but file itself looks empty.

If I type something in a file and save, original file does not seem to change (opened with gedit). _Edited: It actually creates folder named "smb:" in my home directory, and saves file here._

But if I now close and again open file in Atom, file does not even open but red notification appears, saying:

Uncaught Error: ENOTDIR: not a directory, open 'smb:/path/to/filename/smb:/path/to/filename/smb:/path/to/filename'
/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/workspace.js:466

Error: ENOTDIR: not a directory, open 'smb:/path/to/filename/smb:/path/to/filename/smb:/path/to/filename'
    at Error (native)
    at Object.fs.openSync (fs.js:544:18)
    at Object.module.(anonymous function) [as openSync](ATOM_SHELL_ASAR.js:118:20)
    at Project.module.exports.Project.open (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/project.js:371:27)
    at Workspace.module.exports.Workspace.openURIInPane (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/workspace.js:449:31)
    at Workspace.module.exports.Workspace.open (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/workspace.js:375:19)
    at EventEmitter.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/window-event-handler.js:46:25)
    at emitTwo (events.js:87:13)
    at EventEmitter.emit (events.js:169:7)

data.title: modifying menus/win32.cson shows not effect.
data.body:
I tried to change some menu text.
So modifed menus/win32.cson. but it shows nothing different.
There is no effect..

./script/clean didn't help. 

What should i do to modify menu?

data.title: autocomplete does not work with non-ascii words
data.body:
I am not sure which package to blame for this but autocomplet does not work with non-ascii words. 

When I type eg. "Immat" I get the autocomplete proposal "Immaterialgut" but not "ImmaterialgÃ¼ter". I guess autocomplete does not work with non-ascii chars at all. Thatmay be ok for programmers but not for writers, because we have a lot of non-ascii words out there.

data.title: Atom 1.0 vs Windows VM
data.body:
Editor keeps freezing when running inside a Windows VM ( Server 2008r2 to be specific -10Gb total VM memory).

Usually it freezes under the Package view when trying to browse / update the list.

data.title: Grey not properly syntax hilighted
data.body:
This is super small, but _grey_ isn't properly syntax highlighted / recognized as a valid color value ([which it is](http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-color/#grey)).

I don't think it's super relevant, but I am using Atom 1.0 on Windows 8.

![error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4407518/8491579/c29d4a9e-2109-11e5-84e1-bbd84845a270.png)

data.title: Toggle Soft Tabs command: tweaks for improved user experience
data.body:
When toggling soft tabs through the command palette, there's no UI feedback about if it worked and what the new state is.  The only way to tell is to turn on invisible characters and try hitting tab.

Suggestions:
- emit a notification which displays the new state of the setting
- add two new commands "Enable soft tabs" and "Disable soft tabs" to avoid this issue altogether
- an icon in the status bar showing softness of tabs?

Also, the command could be named "Toggle Soft Tabs **In Current Editor**" since this local behavior may be surprising -- the soft tabs checkbox in settings is a global setting.

data.title: Cmd+up/down doesn't work with multi-line select
data.body: When trying to select multiple lines that all have a particular string with cmd+D and move them up or down within the document, Atom will select the lines properly, but when trying to move them it de-selects the additional lines and only moves the originally selected line. If you select multiple lines with the mouse or with Cmd+L it works just fine, and It still deletes multiple lines properly when selected with cmd+D - it's just moving lines that fails. I've taken a screen capture of the bug to illustrate what happens, which is viewable here: https://slack-files.com/T024TD89T-F075EUW8K-1e3ac80187

data.title: Soft wraps not working by default
data.body:
Hi!

I use Atom 1.0 on Windows 7 x64 (also on Windows 8.1 x64).

Two problems:
1. I can't found how to enable soft wraps option to all opened files, not per file.
2. I can't see checkbox or something that show the state of soft wraps in **View -> Toggle Soft Wrap** 

Also described here:
https://discuss.atom.io/t/turn-on-line-wrap/1627

data.title: Atom continuously crashing on Mac OS X
data.body: Running Mac OS X Yosemite. Trying to edit any files, atom freezes up, then is not responding, then has to be force quit. Restarting app/Force quitting not solving issue.

data.title: Nested PHP scope not detected properly
data.body:
The scope of a block of PHP code that is enclosed inside of a separate language (ie. within a JS block in a page) is not detected properly if the enclosing PHP tags are both on the same line. If the tags are not separated onto different lines then Atom thinks the code is just part of the enclosing code block.

For example, this bit of code is incorrectly detected as part of the JavaScript block:

``` php
<html>
<head>
    <script type="text/javascript">
    <?php echo 'test'; ?>
    </script>
</head>
</html>
```

![screenshot from 2015-07-02 14 22 25](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/427137/8488254/2724c51c-20c6-11e5-9ca2-2aac8c7c8dbf.png)

While this code is properly detected as being a PHP block:

``` php
<html>
<head>
    <script type="text/javascript">
    <?php
    echo 'test';
    ?>
    </script>
</head>
</html>
```

![screenshot from 2015-07-02 14 23 06](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/427137/8488257/2e924252-20c6-11e5-9efa-831ef95bdccc.png)

---

This issue is present on a completely fresh Atom installation, as well as one with a multitude of plugins.
Atom Version: 1.0.0
Operating Systems:
- Ubuntu 15.04 x64
- Windows 8.1 x64

data.title: `event.target` in context menu `created` not always intended target
Filename tooltip doesn't update after renaming file
data.body:
I'm on Atom 1.0. To reproduce:
- Open a file in Atom. Scrolling over its tab will show a tooltip with its full path.
- Rename the file in tree view.
- Now, scrolling over the tab will still show the previous file path.

data.title: ctrl-delete does not remove CRLF
data.body:
By `ctrl-delete` I mean `editor:delete-to-next-word-boundary`, `editor:delete-to-end-of-word` or  `editor:select-to-beginning-of-word` (which is probably used by the first two commands).

I.e. when issuing the above commands in this position:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5153846/8487587/5285ae6e-210d-11e5-868b-e41bb9378dd0.png)

**Nothing** happens, the `CRLF` windows line-ending is not consumed.

Linux's `LF` works fine, though (`editor:delete-to-next-word-boundary`):

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5153846/8487775/7565e1b4-210e-11e5-9206-085256a411e9.png)

Also, the other way round (`editor:delete-to-previous-word-boundary` etc.) works fine.

Windows 7, Atom 1.0

data.title: Ignored Names still show up in tree-view
data.body:
I am not sure if this is a new issue, if I'm doing something wrong or if this is supposed to work this way. But I was pretty sure that when I first added some files into the `Ignored Names` area that they did properly get hidden in the `tree-view`.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2923/8487380/b760f246-20d9-11e5-9b39-a524a1eeb909.png)

The only thing I recently did was to collapse the whole project folder. When I then uncollapsed it is the first time I noticed the hidden files and folders showing. And now I can't get rid of them. I tried restarting atom as well as editing the `Ignored Files` section again.

data.title: Include underscore in subword regex
data.body:
Similarly to #7656, this is a change I made after the Atom PR.  When going left or right, the cursor should skip over the underscore.
###### Example (edited)

If the cursor starts on the left, and going right:

```
|my_variable
```

**Option 1)** How it is now:

```
my|_variable
```

go right again

```
my_|variable
```

go right again

```
my_variable|
```

**Option 2)**

```
my_|variable
```

go right again

```
my_variable|
```

**Option 3)** More Sublime like:

```
my|_variable
```

go right again

```
my_variable|
```

I don't have a good argument for either case.  Sublime Text uses Option 2 so it is probably what people are used to.  Option 1 is useful when deleting subwords to change the variable text.  However, Option 2 saves keystrokes in most cases.

I'm willing to make the fix, but wanted to get a issue started if discussion is required.

https://github.com/dsandstrom/atom-subword-navigation/blob/b579b03bb95e6a2cdb634a7411b40cb29bd6c5c4/lib/subword-navigation.coffee#L62

data.title: Non UTF-8 encoding files needs better performance while loading
data.body:
I use my **File Encoding** setting as _Windows 1252_, because I mostly use this kind of file with Atom. And every time I open a large file (let's say 500Kb size, 10k lines), Atom freezes. After a while Atom displays that _keep waiting / close_ window, and sometimes it will load, sometimes not.

Atom always open the file as _UTF-8_. I noted it because I can see the erroneous characters instead of  accented words, and then it _changes_ the encoding to _Windows 1252_. If I use **File Encoding** as _UTF-8_, the file is opened almost instantaneously (but with that erroneous characters).

It should avoid the _UTF-8_ loading step, and directly open it as the defined encoding.

data.title: Add non-English letters to subword regex
data.body:
I made some changes to my subword regex after I submitted the Atom PR.  One being I added support for non-English characters to the regex.  I'm willing to submit a fix, but wanted to get a issue started in case there are objections.

Basically, I use these in the regexes:

``` coffee
lowercaseLetters = 'a-z\\u00DF-\\u00F6\\u00F8-\\u00FF'
uppercaseLetters = 'A-Z\\u00C0-\\u00D6\\u00D8-\\u00DE'
```

https://github.com/dsandstrom/atom-subword-navigation/blob/b579b03bb95e6a2cdb634a7411b40cb29bd6c5c4/lib/subword-navigation.coffee#L62

data.title: Buffer finder (cmd-b) does not list all open buffers
data.body:
The fuzzy buffer finder (cmd-b) doesn't list all open buffers. For me specifically, the "settings" buffer and add-on package iterm2 buffers.

This is important for people who rely on the keyboard for navigating. I realize that cmd-, gets people to the settings tab but there should still be a unified way to get to any open tab, otherwise each package would have to implement its own open-existing-instance technique. Emacs handles this well: 

![screen shot 2015-07-02 at 12 51 03 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8050526/8482690/444b8ebc-20b9-11e5-84b6-9b8e66029e45.png)

![screen shot 2015-07-02 at 1 03 22 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8050526/8482907/c8474ea8-20ba-11e5-8e55-bbd528157236.png)
![screen shot 2015-07-02 at 1 03 42 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8050526/8482909/cba3a5c4-20ba-11e5-8def-059b6a179445.png)

data.title: Move-Line-Down doesn't move entire line below last line
data.body:
Selecting an entire line (or lines) prevents `editor:move-line-down` to swap it
with the last line in the editor.

Note: It does work when not selecting the entire line (i.e. not selecting the newline char)

![GIF:](http://media.giphy.com/media/xTiTnoUoSJL5vHiLKw/giphy.gif)
## Repro Steps
1. Open a file in the main editor
2. Select an entire line or lines
3. Use `editor:move-line-down` (or default `Ctrl-Down`)
4. Try to move it below the last line in the editor

**Expected:** The selected line swaps with the last line
**Actual:** It doesn't do anything
## Versions
- **Atom:**       1.0.0
- **Electron:** 0.22.3
- **OS:**         linux 3.19.0-15-generic
- **Misc**
  - apm  1.0.1
  - npm  2.5.1
  - node 0.10.35
  - python 2.7.9
  - git 2.1.4

---

<small>This report was created using the package `bug-report` v0.7.1.</small>

data.title: Do not search big files automatically
data.body:
Big files are a nightmare to search in because the IDE starts searching automatically as soon as you enter a letter.

Which crashes the IDE. Which makes you restart it or wait for 5 minutes.

This happened on a Core i7, not a Commodore.

Disable automatic search on big files please!

data.title: SSHFS disconnection causes irreversible loss of data
data.body:
1. I am working with Atom on a largish-project (80.000 files) mounted with sshfs
2. For some reason the mounted volume disconnected and I got the following error trying to save.  So far so good: the reason is pretty clear (although rather than a brutal error in red, one could possibly have a neat message explaining the volume is not mounted.
3. The **dangerous thing** is that one had pressed the close button on Atom, and answered "save" to the question about changes, Atom would still successfully close and **all changes would be lost without notifications of sort**.
4. The **annoying** thing, is that when this happens, the indexing of the entire tree (in my case 80K+ files is lost, and **a complete reindexing is in order** at the next attempt to use <kbd>CTRL</kbd>+<kbd>P</kbd>

**Atom Version**: 1.0.0
**System**: "Fedora release
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: ENOTCONN: socket is not connected, open '/home/mac/jail/dev29/blocket'

```
At /usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/workspace.js:466

Error: ENOTCONN: socket is not connected, open '/home/mac/jail/dev29/blocket'
    at Error (native)
    at Object.fs.openSync (fs.js:544:18)
    at Object.module.(anonymous function) [as openSync] (ATOM_SHELL_ASAR.js:118:20)
    at Project.module.exports.Project.open (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/project.js:371:27)
    at Workspace.module.exports.Workspace.openURIInPane (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/workspace.js:449:31)
    at Workspace.module.exports.Workspace.open (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/workspace.js:375:19)
    at EventEmitter.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/window-event-handler.js:46:25)
    at emitTwo (events.js:87:13)
    at EventEmitter.emit (events.js:169:7)
```

    ]
